SEARCH
Package gw.api.snapshot

Class ClaimSnapshotUtil

java.lang.Object
gw.api.snapshot.ClaimSnapshotUtil
public class ClaimSnapshotUtil extends Object
Utilities for displaying claim snapshots. A claim snapshot is taken when a claim is first entered into the system, either from the new claim wizard or by SOAP import. It is an XML dump of the claim state as it was at that point. Claim snapshots are unusual because they are not upgraded as the ClaimCenter version changes so, for example, snapshots taken in ClaimCenter 3.0.x still reflect the data structures as they were in 3.0.x. Because of this we have different sets of PCF pages for displaying different snapshot versions, each set tailored to the data structures as they were at the time the snapshot was taken. Snapshot objects are not entities, but they are integrated with the Gosu type system so you can use PCF to display them. However they are not as strongly typed as normal entities because their types have to be deduced from the contents of the snapshot rather than being fully described via the datamodel files and metadata.

  • Method Details

    • hasSnapshot

      public static boolean hasSnapshot(Claim claim)
      Determines whether or not a snapshot exists for the given claim. The result of this enquiry is stored in the UI session state so that subsequent calls are fast.

    • getSnapshot

      public static ISnapshotEntity getSnapshot(Claim claim)
      Returns the claim snapshot object for the given claim. The claim snapshot object is not a normal entity but it is integrated with the Gosu typing system so it can be displayed in PCF. There is a Gosu class library, util.Snapshot, containing utilities to help display the weakly typed snapshot objects. This method caches its result in the UI session so subsequent calls will be fast.

    • getPageVersion

      public static String getPageVersion(ISnapshotEntity snapshot)
      Return the snapshot page version number which best matches the version of the given snapshot. There are sets of snapshot pages for the major releases of ClaimCenter (for example the pages with suffix 300 are for the 3.0.x releases, those with suffix 310 are for the 3.1.x releases and so on). This method looks at the version of the given snapshot object and returns the suffix that best matches the object's version.

    • getClaimDataUncompressedFromSnapshot

      public static String getClaimDataUncompressedFromSnapshot(ClaimSnapshot claimSnapshot) throws IOException
      Throws:
      IOException
